comments.body: The latest version of `pip` automatically logs commit SHA when installing a package from a git repository: https://github.com/pypa/pip/pull/10149
Are we running the latest version of `pip`?
@dbczumar Yes! https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/c80598208c63ae74d87f2011bafb651c9a843fb7/.github/workflows/cross-version-tests.yml#L126

          git+https://github.com/catboost/catboost.git#subdirectory=catboost/python-package
      fi
      pip install $CACHE_DIR/catboost-*.whl

comments.body: Simplified the command.
Used `--dist-dir` to build the wheel in `CACHE_DIR`

        cd python
        python setup.py bdist_wheel --dist-dir $CACHE_DIR

comments.body:
I added `head_sha` to make it easier to identify the commit SHA but I found `pip freeze` shows it:

https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/pull/4534/checks?check_run_id=2999114540#step:10:67

```
scikit-learn @ git+https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn.git@f2fb07581339f063b501b3e820917d66ee4c1fa3
```
`pip` automatically run `git submodule update --init --recursive` when the repo contains submodules.

comments.body: For catboost, use `pip wheel` becuase we want to cache the built wheel.

## Before:

https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/runs/2826922461?check_suite_focus=true#step:9:28

```
+ pip install --pre torch -f https://download.pytorch.org/whl/nightly/cpu/torch_nightly.html
Looking in links: https://download.pytorch.org/whl/nightly/cpu/torch_nightly.html
Requirement already satisfied: torch in /usr/share/miniconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages (1.8.1)
Requirement already satisfied: dataclasses in /usr/share/miniconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from torch) (0.8)
Requirement already satisfied: numpy in /usr/share/miniconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from torch) (1.19.5)
Requirement already satisfied: typing-extensions in /usr/share/miniconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from torch) (3.10.0.0)
```

```
+ pip install --upgrade --pre torch -f https://download.pytorch.org/whl/nightly/cpu/torch_nightly.html
Looking in links: https://download.pytorch.org/whl/nightly/cpu/torch_nightly.html

Collecting torch
  Downloading https://download.pytorch.org/whl/nightly/cpu/torch-1.10.0.dev20210615%2Bcpu-cp36-cp36m-linux_x86_64.whl (179.9 MB)
Requirement already satisfied: dataclasses in /usr/share/miniconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from torch) (0.8)
Requirement already satisfied: typing-extensions in /usr/share/miniconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from torch) (3.10.0.0)
Installing collected packages: torch
  Attempting uninstall: torch

    Uninstalling torch-1.9.0:
      Successfully uninstalled torch-1.9.0
```

comments.body: As described in https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/20189, installing with PEP 517 seems to be the root cause. As a workaround, use `--no-use-pep517` option.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +6,10 @@      #       https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/20189 is fixed
      pip install Cython numpy scipy
      pip install --no-use-pep517 git+https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn.git

  models:

comments.body:
Switched to installing from GitHub because it looks like `spacy-nightly` hasn't been updated for a while:
https://pypi.org/project/spacy-nightly/#history

With this change, the version of spacy will change to `3.0.0rc5` to `3.0.6` ([see this](https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/blob/master/spacy/about.py#L3)), which should fix the issue because the version comparison `Version(spacy.__version__) >= Version("3.0.0")` evaluates to `True`.
It worked: https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/pull/4389/checks?check_run_id=2662886297
Wonderful! Thanks @harupy !

comments.body:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/5177e09c9f302372137f28ab7798a8a413c352f7/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/setup.py#L105-L107

```python
    # TODO(scottzhu): OSS keras hasn't been formally released yet. 
    # Use keras-nightly at the moment.
    'keras-nightly ~= 2.5.0.dev',
```

Looks like it'll be removed once keras 2.5 is released
why not also add `-Dorg.slf4j.simpleLogger.defaultLogLevel=WARN` ?
What is the motivation?
If we need this change, I'll create a follow-up PR.
